title: The Supreme Court Killed His Tariffs. He Raised Them Anyway.
summary: SCOTUS struck down IEEPA tariffs. Within hours, Trump imposed new ones under a different law.
content:
The Supreme Court ruled 9-0: **IEEPA does not authorize the President to impose tariffs.**

The decision was unambiguous. Chief Justice Roberts delivered the opinion. Every justice agreed.

## $133B | Already collected in tariffs now ruled illegal

Businesses want refunds. The government collected the money. The legal fight over repayment starts now.

But Trump didn't wait.

Within hours of the ruling, he signed a new proclamation. **Section 122 of the Trade Act of 1974** — a law that allows emergency tariffs for 150 days.

## 15% | The new global tariff rate

First he set it at 10%. Then he raised it to 15%. The highest effective tariff rate since 1936.

>> "The tariff regime falls most heavily on metal products, electrical equipment, and motor vehicles." — Yale Budget Lab

The Budget Lab estimates **every American household loses �-800** while these tariffs are in effect.

If they expire in 150 days, the economy takes a 0.1% permanent hit. If they don't expire — and nothing about this administration suggests restraint — it doubles.

The Supreme Court said no. The President said: watch me.

!! The law won. The power didn't care. That's the pattern now.
